comment: Had her for 1102. She gives great instruction and is willing to help. Class was based on one essay that we worked on all semester. No tests or quizzes. Just class work that you use to put together your essay. Not challenging at all. Would take her again!

Awesome teacher. She tells you what she wants in each paper (and puts it online). As long as you include the things she asks for in each paper, you should be fine. She gives good feedback and is really willing to help you if you need it. I got an 87 in 1101 because i didn't follow the guidelines of one paper. Most likely getting an A in 1102.
Her class is great. She elaborates on all the stories we're supposed to read and the reading quizzes and tests are super easy if you know the readings.

I would not take her again. She is a very nice woman and extremely helpful BUT her expectations are still not clear. For our papers, there were instructions but no rubric so we had a faint idea of what were we were actually being graded on. And if you don't like peer editing, stay away! Peer editing was about 60% of the class and a waste of time.

She is a good teacher who gets straight to the point. Her assignments are simple just read what she tells you to outside of class. She has regular reading quizzes, but doesnt tell you when they are, but you can usually tell. There are three tests but once again they are easy. She doesnt try to trick you or surprise you just read and go to class.

You have to read so much for this class. It's one of those classes that will stress you out especially if you have other classes andor a job. You must really know the text and multiple literary terms. She gives a quiz almost every week I'm on financial aid so I didn't have the book for the first 2 quizzes she gave out. Tests are long and written.

Professor Odak is really laid back and is easy to talk to if you need help regarding an assignment. There were 4 papers and none of them exceeded 5 pages, however; you stick with the same topic for each paper. The class is really easy if you follow her criteria for the papers. I will definitely take her again.
Professor Odak was great! 4 total papers, all relatively short, no tests or quizzes, and easy class assignments. Made an A on all of my papers, but attendance is mandatory. Only allowed 3 absences.

Professor Odak is awesome! I absolutely hate the subject of english as I always have, but she made this the funnest english class I have ever taken. She is incredibly nice, helpful, and hilarious, and almost all homework grades are for participation. She only gives 4 essays throughout the semester for English 1101, I STRONGLY recommend this class!!

Attend class. It seriously helps on the world literature tests. Tests are not hard, do not stress. But do study! Read the sections because there are occasional pop quizzes, but they're never too hard. Awesome professor!
Mrs. Odak is very straightforward with her expectations and she is willing to help with anything. Just do what is required and you'll make an A, no problem.

She explains what the assignments are and give you outlines and tools to help you write the paper. If you email her about anything, you will get a response within an hour. In her class there are four essays that she grades fairly but hard at the same time, but gives a lot of feedback. Each paper you write will be on the same topic that you choose.

Prof Odak is awesome. She's nice, but pretty nerdy and laughs at her own jokes. Grades come from 4 essays which she grader fairly. I don't like Lit but I managed to pull an A pretty easily. Overall she's a great teacher and I would for sure take her again in the future.
